nodes.text: We should keep supporting the policy in the Middle East

In 1946 18 months after the fall of Berlin to allied forces a journalist wrote in the New York Times  Germany is ... a land in an acute stage of economic political and moral crisis.     [European] capitals are frightened. In every [military] headquarters one meets alarmed officials doing their utmost to deal with the consequences of the occupation policy that they admit has failed.
And because that generation of Americans held firm in the cause of liberty we live in a better and safer world today
Fortunately we had a resolute president named Truman who with the American people persevered knowing that a new democracy at the center of Europe would lead to stability and peace.
Some journalists doubted of the American policy in 1946
President Truman's resolution and Americans' support of liberty was the best thing to do to live in a safer world
The president now believes that a democracy at the centre of Middle East will lead to stability
